keyTakeAways: Brandy left the stage abruptly during a Chicago concert of the 'Boy Is Mine' tour with Monica, causing public confusion and disappointment.
Brandy apologized for her exit, citing dehydration and a feeling of fainting after weeks of intense rehearsals, emphasizing her prioritization of health.
Monica stepped in to complete the performance solo, demonstrating professionalism and grace, which drew praise from fans and the public.
The tour, named after the 1998 duet, was expected to feature the song, but it was not performed during the incident, leading to fan disappointment.
Brandy described the original duet as a meaningful moment of unity between two young women, highlighting its global emotional resonance.
There were prior speculations about tension between Brandy and Monica, but the incident did not confirm ongoing rivalry; instead, it emphasized mutual respect and teamwork.

summaryOfNewsArticle: During a concert in Chicago as part of the 'Boy Is Mine' tour, Brandy abruptly left the stage, leaving Monica to perform the remainder of the show solo. Brandy later apologized, stating she experienced dehydration and a sensation of fainting after weeks of intense rehearsals, and emphasized that her health was the top priority. The incident sparked public confusion and disappointment, especially since the tour was named after their 1998 duet, which was not performed. Brandy credited Monica’s grace and professionalism in stepping up, and highlighted the original duet’s deep emotional resonance with fans worldwide. The event underscores both the significance of the joint tour and the importance of performer well-being, even in high-pressure live settings.
title: Brandy explains why she left Monica all alone on stage
